metadata.Title: CVE-2018-20346 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
SQLite before 3.25.3, when the FTS3 extension is enabled, encounters an integer overflow (and resultant buffer overflow) for FTS3 queries that occur after crafted changes to FTS3 shadow tables, allowing remote attackers to execute arbitrary code by leveraging the ability to run arbitrary SQL statements (such as in certain WebSQL use cases), aka Magellan.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20346` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

lemon - 3.11.0-1ubuntu1.2
libsqlite3-0 - 3.11.0-1ubuntu1.2
libsqlite3-tcl - 3.11.0-1ubuntu1.2
sqlite3 - 3.11.0-1ubuntu1.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sqlite3 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-1ubuntu1.2').
